articles.headline: Fox News’s Convention Moment Overshadowed by Struggle Over Ailes’s Fate
articles.snippet: As speculation swirled that the Murdoch family had decided Roger Ailes must leave, the company issued a statement that the matter was “not yet resolved.”
articles.abstract: As speculation swirled that the Murdoch family had decided Roger Ailes must leave, the company issued a statement that the matter was “not yet resolved.”
articles.lead_paragraph: CLEVELAND — This was supposed to be Fox News Channel’s big week, a time to flex its muscles and flaunt its ratings dominance as the long-reigning media king of the Republican National Convention.

articles.headline: Yahoo Edges Toward Its Sale With a Limp
articles.snippet: As Yahoo accepted the final bids for its core business, it revealed just how badly that business was deteriorating: revenue fell 15 percent last quarter and profit dropped 64 percent.
articles.abstract: As Yahoo accepted the final bids for its core business, it revealed just how badly that business was deteriorating: revenue fell 15 percent last quarter and profit dropped 64 percent.
articles.lead_paragraph: SAN FRANCISCO — As Yahoo accepted the final bids for its core business on Monday, the internet company revealed just how badly that business was deteriorating.

articles.headline: Trump and Pence: On the Same Ticket, but Not on the Same Page
articles.snippet: Donald J. Trump and Gov. Mike Pence are on the record as having very different attitudes on recent fiscal policy.
articles.abstract: Donald J. Trump and Gov. Mike Pence are on the record as having very different attitudes on recent fiscal policy.
articles.lead_paragraph: If there is one thing consistent about the business views of Gov. Mike Pence of Indiana — better known as Donald J. Trump’s running mate — it is that they are often at odds with the views of Mr. Trump, who has campaigned on his business expertise.

articles.headline: Rancor Reigns as Bitterly Divided Republicans Begin Their Convention
articles.snippet: Renegade delegates forced a floor fight to embarrass Donald J. Trump on Monday, while a top aide excoriated Ohio’s governor for not endorsing Mr. Trump.
articles.abstract: Renegade delegates forced a floor fight to embarrass Donald J. Trump on Monday, while a top aide excoriated Ohio’s governor for not endorsing Mr. Trump.
articles.lead_paragraph: CLEVELAND — Rancor and hard-edged attacks dominated the start of the Republican National Convention on Monday as speakers branded Hillary Clinton as a liar who deserved to be in prison and two African-American Republicans ridiculed the Black Lives Matter movement.
articles.byline: By Jonathan Martin and Patrick Healy

articles.headline: It’s Donald Trump’s Convention. But the Inspiration? Nixon.
articles.snippet: On the opening night of the Republican National Convention, Donald J. Trump was conspicuously trying to conjure somebody else: Richard M. Nixon.
articles.abstract: On the opening night of the Republican National Convention, Donald J. Trump was conspicuously trying to conjure somebody else: Richard M. Nixon.
articles.lead_paragraph: CLEVELAND — Let Trump be Trump, his aides have always insisted. And let his convention serve as an unapologetic tribute to his singular, erratic, untamed persona.
articles.byline: By Michael Barbaro and Alexander Burns

articles.headline: Google, Trying to Endear Itself to Europe, Spreads $450 Million Around
articles.snippet: The company is financing a series of projects supporting European culture and education as its regulatory woes continue to compound.
articles.abstract: The company is financing a series of projects supporting European culture and education as its regulatory woes continue to compound.
articles.lead_paragraph: A yearlong digital training course for Irish high school teachers started in 2014. A fund to help European news outlets adapt to the web popped up in 2015. And in March, a virtual reality exhibition began at a Belgian museum to showcase a Renaissance painter.

articles.headline: Volkswagen Scandal Reaches All the Way to the Top, Lawsuits Say
articles.snippet: The suits claim the decision to thwart pollution tests involved dozens of engineers and managers, and reached into the company’s boardroom.
articles.abstract: The suits claim the decision to thwart pollution tests involved dozens of engineers and managers, and reached into the company’s boardroom.
articles.lead_paragraph: Three attorneys general on Tuesday directly challenged Volkswagen’s defense over its emissions deception, calling the decision to thwart pollution tests an orchestrated fraud that lasted more than a decade, involved dozens of engineers and managers and reached deep into the company’s boardroom.
articles.byline: By Jack Ewing and Hiroko Tabuchi

articles.headline: How Renewable Energy Is Blowing Climate Change Efforts Off Course
articles.snippet: Solar and wind produce temporary power gluts that drive out other sources that are needed to maintain stable supplies. Worse, they are helping push nuclear power into bankruptcy.
articles.abstract: Solar and wind produce temporary power gluts that drive out other sources that are needed to maintain stable supplies. Worse, they are helping push nuclear power into bankruptcy.
articles.lead_paragraph: Is the global effort to combat climate change, painstakingly agreed to in Paris seven months ago, already going off the rails?
